N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 177.4 - Duties of the ombudsman

State Regulations

The ombudsmen shall: (a) visit facilities and programs in
accordance with priorities established by the office of the ombudsman and the

Director of the Division for Youth; (b) hear grievances and complaints of all
youths under the jurisdiction of the division; (c) investigate alleged violations of the
legal rights of youth under the jurisdiction of the division; (d) monitor and participate in grievance
procedures for residents in secure facilities, pursuant to section 515-a of
article 19-G of the Executive Law and agency policy; (e) monitor the implementation of the
policies and regulations of the division and of the rules and regulations of
other agencies, as they are applicable to the legal rights of youth under the
jurisdiction of the division; (f) monitor and participate in the implementation of statutes, court orders, court
decisions and court stipulations which affect youth under the jurisdiction of
the division; (g) advise or in
other ways assist youth under the jurisdiction of the division to obtain legal
counsel in protecting their legal rights or in seeking legal redress through
the courts or administrative agencies; (h) recommend policies, regulations and/or
legislation aimed at protecting the legal rights of youth under the
jurisdiction of the division; (i) serve as a resource to youth under the jurisdiction of the division by
informing them of pertinent laws, regulations and policies, and their rights
thereunder; and
(j) present
significant complaints and concerns of youth to the Director of the Division
for Youth, the Director of Ombudsman, other appropriate division staff and the

Independent Review Board. Notes
